item.title: AFL draft 2025 club by club preview: Your team's picks and potential targets
item.description: With the AFL draft just around the corner, see which picks each club has to work with and the players they could select.

item.title: Sikh communities celebrate Gurmesh Singh's election as NSW Nationals leader
item.description: Gurmesh Singh's election as the new leader of the NSW Nationals is being hailed as great news for Indian Sikh communities across the state.

item.title: The Australian music groups celebrating major milestone anniversaries in 2025
item.description: Improvising with headlights, a sold-out debut and championing new music are some of the impacts these Australian music groups have made in their decades-long existence.

item.title: Gippsland's Willem Duursma set to become fourth family member to join AFL/AFLW
item.description: Willem Duursma's dancing feet could carry him all the way to the number-one pick at tomorrow night's AFL National Draft.

item.title: Eli Katoa to miss 2026 NRL season after Melbourne Storm star's brain surgery
item.description: Melbourne Storm star Eli Katoa will miss the 2026 NRL season as he continues his recovery from head knocks that forced him to have brain surgery.

item.title: Vanuatu council repeals law banning menstruating women from selling food
item.description: A Vanuatu provincial government says it will repeal parts of its new bylaw banning menstruating women from preparing and selling food at markets and roadside stalls after the decision sparked a public outcry.

item.title: Asbestos contamination of children's sand was a fluke discovery in an Australian lab
item.description: An Australian lab discovered asbestos in children's play sand by chance and regulators only found out about it because of a podcast interview, the ABC can reveal.

item.title: Inside The Hood Contender, Australia's controversial amateur fighting competition trying to save men's lives
item.description: The organiser of this fight club says it saves lives. But critics say it is putting young men at serious risk.

item.title: Alleged manslaughter victim had cuts, bruises and off-smelling school lunches, court told
item.description: A girl who died, allegedly as a result of criminal neglect by her mother, had attended school with bruises and had lunches that "didn't seem" edible, a court has heard.

item.title: Brisbane Lions recruit Neasa Dooley wanting to add more Irish success in AFLW preliminary final against Carlton Blues
item.description: No stranger to the big stage, Brisbane's Neasa Dooley wants a piece of what her fellow Irish imports have been selling.

item.title: Judge blocks use of National Guard in Memphis
item.description: A Tennessee judge has blocked the use of the National Guard in Memphis, but also put the order on hold, giving the government five days to appeal.

item.title: What it's like being a male early childhood educator amid the childcare crisis
item.description: While the childcare crisis has left me concerned about my own child's safety, as a male early childhood educator, I'm also worried about the future of men in the sector, writes Ben.

item.title: Parents in 'childcare desert' left scrambling as Playtime Preschool enters voluntary administration
item.description: One of the few childcare operators in Broken Hill has closed its doors indefinitely with 24 hours warning after entering voluntary administration.

item.title: Defence inspector inadvertently omitted 10 consultations held with NACC chief Paul Brereton
item.description: A previous disclosure that the head of the federal corruption watchdog had been consulted 11 times has been corrected to 21.

item.title: Sydney waste water likely origin of debris on Central Coast beaches
item.description: Sydney Water is working to determine the source of high levels of grease and oil that caused debris balls to wash up on beaches across Sydney and the Central Coast.

item.title: COP30 decision by South Korea to shut down coal a reckoning for Australian exports
item.description: In a move that has been welcomed by climate campaigners, South Korea has vowed to phase out coal, sparking a warning for Australian exporters.

item.title: Queensland man to face murder trial over house fire death of Damian Bradley Ramsay
item.description: A court has heard a man charged with arson over a fatal house fire admitted to lighting the fire and threatened to burn down his own family home.

item.title: Numerous Tasmanian public, Catholic and independent schools to close from Wednesday
item.description: More than 50 Tasmanian schools will either close or be partially closed from Wednesday in response to ongoing public health concerns relating to asbestos in coloured sand.

item.title: Remote Aboriginal community of Tjuntjuntjara challenges local government election result
item.description: A remote Aboriginal corporation lodges a formal dispute over the outcome of a local government election decided by just one vote.

item.title: WA Police reveal number plate recognition trial in operation at Westfield Carousel
item.description: Cameras that record the number plates of all the vehicles that enter one of Perth's biggest shopping centres are being used to track criminals, WA police have revealed.

item.title: Senator Fatima Payman calls on prime minister to denounce online trolls
item.description: After the man who threatened her life via email was sentenced in court earlier this week, Senator Fatima Payman is being targeted by online abuse.

item.title: Most restrictive abortion bill in the US being considered
item.description: Restrictions on IUDs and IVF and decades of imprisonment for having an abortion could become the reality for some women living in South Carolina if the legislation passes.

item.title: Woman jailed for stabbing AFP officer with pen at Perth Airport
item.description: A woman who stabbed a federal police officer at Perth Airport with a pen in a "vicious" attack is sentenced to more than two years in prison.

item.title: Asbestos contamination identified in imported coloured sand products
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Are tiger prawns labelled as being Australian, really from Australia?
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: P-plater in unregistered and unroadworthy vehicle jailed over fatal crash which killed cyclist
item.description: A P-plater in an uninsured, unregistered and unroadworthy vehicle hit and killed a cyclist last year. Today, he was jailed.

item.title: Woman 'devastated' after alleged violent offender released into community without tracker
item.description: The former partner of a man accused of raping and strangling her says she fears for her life after he was released on bail without a GPS tracking device.

item.title: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese heralds WA gallium project as 'game changing'
item.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese visits the future West Australian gallium processing plant site, central to the United States critical minerals deal, heralding it as a "game changing" project.

item.title: Japan warns citizens in China to be careful as diplomatic spat continues over Taiwan
item.description: Authorities have told Japanese people in China to avoid large crowds, as tensions between Tokyo and Beijing continue to simmer.

item.title: Jess Wilson is the Victorian Liberals’ survival strategy. Are federal Liberals listening?
item.description: The Liberals in two big Australian states are realigning themselves — shifting to what Sussan Ley once described as the sensible centre.

item.title: How the Nintendo Wii's remote control changed gaming — one strike at a time
item.description: Innovative motion controls and accessible design made the Nintendo Wii one of the most popular consoles of all time.

item.title: Booker Prize quiz: Test your knowledge of the prestigious book award
item.description: The prestigious Booker Prize, worth $100,000, announced its 2025 winner last week. Do you remember who won? Test your knowledge of the world's favourite book awards with our quiz.

item.title: Industry experts say TPG Telecom should have done more to address Triple Zero issue
item.description: There are growing questions about whether one of Australia's largest telcos could have done more to ensure customers would be able to call Triple Zero.

item.title: How often should you pay your mortgage to save?
item.description: Switching to fortnightly repayments from monthly — if you can afford it — can help you pay down your mortgage faster. Here’s why.

item.title: Trainers of Melbourne and Caulfield Cup winner, Half Yours, welcomed home to Streaky Bay
item.description: Horse trainer Tony McEvoy returned to his hometown of Streaky Bay, on South Australia's west coast, with trophies in tow after his horse Half Yours' recent wins at the Caulfield and Melbourne cups.

item.title: ACCC traces some coloured asbestos sand to 'a particular quarry in China'
item.description: Some of the coloured sand found to contain asbestos has been traced to a quarry in China, according to the ACCC.

item.title: US politics: Congress agrees to force release of Epstein files and paves way for Trump sign-off — as it happened
item.description: Both houses of the US Congress have agreed to force Justice officials to release documents relating to the investigation into convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. Look back on the day's events here.

item.title: Family of missing schoolboy Terry Floyd accuse government of breaking promise
item.description: The brother of schoolboy Terry Floyd, who disappeared 50 years ago, has accused the Victorian government of breaking its public promise to fund the search for his remains.

item.title: Asbestos sand contamination leaves families seeking clearer house cleaning, disposal guidance
item.description: One Queensland grandmother says her daughter had vacuumed, and even replaced her vacuum cleaner, after removing the asbestos-contaminated sand following "confusing" advice.

item.title: US Senate passes bill to release Epstein files in win for defiant Republicans
item.description: The bill's passage marks a major win for a small group of Republicans who defied pressure from the Trump White House to drop their crusade for the release of the Epstein files.

item.title: England's Joe Root backed to make first Ashes Test century in Australia
item.description: With the first Ashes clash only two days away, Joe Root's England teammates are unfazed by the fact he has not scored a Test century in Australia.

item.title: The AFL draft might be broken for the league's biggest strugglers
item.description: The AFL draft is more complicated and compromised than ever before, meaning clubs rebuilding from the bottom of the ladder are doing so with one arm tied behind their backs.

item.description: Some people refer to attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder as "a superpower" while others describe their ADHD symptoms as debilitating. Can both be true?

item.description: State and territory leaders express concern about how the federal government is approaching its public hospital funding negotiations. Take a look back at the day's coverage here.

item.title: ABC host Sharnelle Vella expecting a baby after fertility struggle
item.description: The ABC Radio Melbourne breakfast co-host and her husband say they are overjoyed but terrified as they prepare for the birth of their baby girl in March.

item.description: Wallabies outside centre Joseph-Aukuso Suaalii is recognised for his performances since switching codes from rugby league late last year.

item.description: Experts warn against signing up for autism therapies that are not evidence-based, as diagnoses rise.

item.title: NSW government to bring in tougher laws to combat public displays of Nazi ideology
item.description: Police and courts will be given greater powers to combat public displays of Nazi ideology in NSW following a rally outside state parliament earlier this month.

item.title: Mechelle Turvey leads calls for more Indigenous community liaison officers in WA Police Force
item.description: Cassius Turvey's mother Mechelle is leading the call for WA Police to hire more Indigenous community liaison officers, saying just 20 officers to serve the entire state was nowhere near enough.

item.title: Stephanie Gilmore announces World Surf League Championship Tour comeback
item.description: Two years after stepping away from the tour, Australian surfing legend Stephanie Gilmore will make her return in 2026 after being awarded a season wildcard.

item.title: West Coast's rebuild is at a critical juncture. This draft could make or break it
item.description: The worst performing team in the AFL has a bumper hand in this year's national draft. How it uses it will shape the club's fortunes for the next decade.

item.title: Legislation to stop councils rating some mining land passes lower house of parliament
item.description: The Mount Magnet shire says its reserves would shrink from $3 million to $300,000 if a bill to block shires from rating certain mining land is passed.

item.description: With only eight fluent Nyiyaparli speakers remaining, an Aboriginal group is racing against time to save its 41,000-year-old language.

item.description: Tongans are heading to the polls this week amid concerns that democratic reforms in the country could be short-lived.

item.description: A breathtaking goal from Scott McTominay paves the way for Scotland to qualify for the World Cup finals after a 28-year absence.

item.title: US agrees to $US1bn loan to restart Three Mile Island nuclear power plant
item.description: Once the site of the worst commercial nuclear power accident in the US, Pennsylvania's Three Mile Island will again start producing electricity after the Department of Energy agreed to a $US1 billion ($1.5 billion) loan.

item.title: Socceroos coach Tony Popovic fumes at penalty decision in 3-0 friendly loss to Colombia in New York
item.description: Socceroos coach Tony Popovic laments a "disappointing" penalty decision as the Socceroos fall to a 3-0 loss to Colombia in New York.

item.title: Curaçao and Haiti defy the odds to secure qualification for 2026 FIFA World Cup

item.description: A court prepares to sentence a speeding, drug-affected driver who was on the wrong side of the road before a fatal crash.

item.title: Social housing tenant facing eviction after DV noise complaints wins right to stay
item.description: A mother who was facing eviction from her social housing home after complaints from neighbours will be allowed to stay, after a court finds the incidents mostly stemmed from her domestic violence abuse.

item.title: Have the Epstein files 'ripped MAGA apart'? Maybe not, but there will be fallout
item.description: Before the Epstein files vote, Washington woke to a zero-degree morning, and Marjorie Taylor Greene could see the symbolism. "My first thought was: hell has froze over," she said.

item.title: States launch coordinated attack on federal handling of public hospital negotiations

item.description: ABC Sport and Australian cricketing legend Glenn McGrath part ways due to the former fast bowler's relationship with a betting company.

item.description: Scientists say they are "speechless" after witnessing significant coral death at the World Heritage-listed Ningaloo Reef.

item.description: Lawyers for a North Queensland mother charged with the murder of toddler Tarrin-Macen O'Sullivan are arguing the post-mortem investigation does not rule out other causes of death.

item.description: A Victorian magistrate has indicated that a 41-year-old man charged with manslaughter over the death of Cobram woman Emma Bates will be committed to stand trial.

item.description: Police charge a 31-year-old man they allege is at the helm of an organised crime syndicate distributing black market tobacco in Perth.

item.description: Socceroos star Mary Fowler says she dealt with depression and self-harm, as well as racism from her teammates during her time with Montpellier.

item.title: PFAS inquiry hands down 47 recommendations to better regulate 'forever chemicals' in Australia
item.description: The federal inquiry into "forever chemicals" has asked the federal government to review its health advice on PFAS in light of the growing international consensus of its health risks.

item.title: SA opposition pledges $21m fishing licence buyback amid toxic algal bloom
item.description: The South Australian opposition has pledged a $21-million voluntary fisheries buyback scheme, if it is elected next year, to allow commercial fishers to leave the industry amid the harmful algal bloom.

item.description: Geoffrey Watson SC, who authored a damning report into the CFMEU branch, has given evidence over two days at the inquiry.

item.title: Government canvasses Pacific leaders on backdown option for COP31
item.description: The federal government has begun to contact Pacific leaders to canvass a COP31 "Plan B" which would see Adelaide abandon its bid for the global United Nations climate summit so long as Pacific nations are guaranteed a role in next year's conference.

item.description: Indonesia's Mount Semeru volcano erupts, spewing ash several kilometres into the air and prompting an aviation warning in Australia.

item.description: A Russian drone and missile barrage has killed 25 people, including two children, in a western Ukrainian city, around 200 kilometres from the Polish border.

item.title: Sussan Ley to call for urgent action on defence in Menzies Institute speech
item.description: The opposition leader will pledge to spend 3 per cent of GDP on defence during a speech at the Menzies Institute in Melbourne on Thursday.

item.description: Authorities are still working to extinguish the blaze, which has spread to nearby woodland.

item.title: CSIRO cuts highlight which jobs government protects in national interest

item.title: The International Space Station made colleagues out of Cold War rivals in a new space era
item.description: It was November 20, 1998, and a rocket wasn't an unusual sight in this remote part of Kazakhstan. But today's cargo was a piece of history that would have seemed impossible just years before.

item.title: Cricket Tasmania and stadium proponent say they've found a solution to roof concerns
item.description: Cricket Tasmania and the Macquarie Point stadium proponent believe they have found the solution to concerns about how the stadium's roof could affect cricket.

item.description: England is yet to confirm its final XI, but damaging fast bowlers Jofra Archer and Mark Wood may team up to take on Australia in Perth.

item.description: A German farm worker has been sentenced after pleading guilty to a second sexual assault in regional Western Australia.

item.title: Oscar Piastri tipped to fight back in F1 championship at Las Vegas Grand Prix
item.description: Oscar Piastri is backed to regain form in the final three races of the F1 championship, despite the Australian trailing teammate Lando Norris on the drivers' standings.

item.title: Perth childcare centre fined $50k after child escapes, wanders onto road
item.description: A Perth childcare centre is fined after a child escaped last year, likely by using his "above-average" climbing skills to scale a fence.

item.title: Alternative protein sector expected to triple worldwide by 2032 but struggles for investment
item.description: The world is facing a crisis in food production and alternative sources of protein can be part of the solution, but the fledgling Australian sector is struggling.

item.title: Fire tears through city of Oita in Japan
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: NASA unveils close-up pictures of Comet 3I/Atlas in our solar system
item.description: Discovered in July this year, the comet known as 3I/Atlas is only the third confirmed object to visit our corner of the cosmos from another star.

item.title: NSW police investigate possible links in three Sydney shootings
item.description: Crime scenes have been established after a spree of shootings across Sydney's west and multiple car fires overnight, with "innocent" residents' lives put at risk.

item.title: Sam Kerr set to be fit for Matildas internationals against New Zealand despite Chelsea omission
item.description: Sam Kerr will miss Chelsea's Women's Champions League match against Barcelona on Friday, just days after her club manager said she was likely to play.

item.title: Rupertswood: The Birthplace of the Ashes
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Major retirement developments approved for Bundaberg coastline
item.description: Thousands of retirement and relocatable homes are either under construction or have been approved along a regional Queensland coastline known for its pristine beaches and "affordable" lifestyle.

item.title: Police pulling Aboriginal teenager from bus at gunpoint was 'racial profiling', family alleges
item.description: The family of a 17-year-old Indigenous boy says he was racially profiled when he was pulled from a Canberra bus by police officers who handcuffed him before realising he was the wrong person.

item.title: Kempsey to host New South Wales first trial of in-home mental health treatment service
item.description: NSW will run a state-first trial that will offer mental health patients care in their own home, but it will mean the town trialling the system loses its hospital-based mental health unit.

item.title: NSW Opposition Leader Mark Speakman stays firm amid growing leadership challenge speculation
item.description: NSW Opposition Leader Mark Speakman says no-one has approached him to mount a leadership challenge.

item.title: Gold Coast man Brett Daniel Taylor charged with third count of aiding suicide
item.description: Gold Coast man Brett Daniel Taylor allegedly sold high-strength sedatives to people for the purpose of taking their own lives.

item.title: Cyclone Fina set to impact NT coastal communities between Cape Don and Maningrida from late Friday
item.description: The Bureau of Meteorology says communities between Cape Don on the Cobourg Peninsula and Maningrida — including Minjilang and Warruwi — are set to be the first to experience the impacts of the category two system, from late Friday.

item.title: G20 leaders are 'saving the furniture' as Trump leads a boycott
item.description: Trump's absence could neuter the forum's ability to move the dial on the summit's priorities, including helping nations adapt to weather disasters, the transition to clean energy, cutting excessive debt costs and working together in the global rush for critical minerals.

item.title: Reserve prices to be published under Victorian government underquoting crackdown
item.description: Real estate agents in Victoria will be required to publish a property's reserve price at least seven days before it goes to auction, under new laws the state government says will stamp out illegal underquoting.

item.title: Australia hands COP31 to Türkiye but Chris Bowen to lead negotiations
item.description: Adelaide will not host next year's COP summit, but Australia's energy minister, Chris Bowen, will lead the negotiations, and a pre-event will be hosted by a Pacific Island nation.

item.title: Four arrested six weeks after stabbing death of Gordon Kessey at Bega
item.description: Four people have been arrested at Bega on the NSW South Coast following the fatal stabbing of a 43-year-old man last month.

item.title: Somerville House investigating after teachers' dossier on students leaked
item.description: One of Brisbane's most prestigious all-girls schools is in crisis mode after students were able to access a document where teachers wrote notes about students' appearances, personalities and their parents.

item.title: Is it possible to build a flood-proof house on the banks of the Brisbane River?
item.description: Only someone whose family has long lived next to a river famous for catastrophic flooding would dare to build on this block. Here's what we can all learn from Richard and Janette's new home.

item.title: Family of Aboriginal boy handcuffed by ACT police in case of mistaken identity speaks
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Blaithin Mackin loves playing Gaelic and AFLW but it means living a double life
item.description: Melbourne premiership player Blaithin Mackin loves playing both Gaelic and AFLW — but it means living a double life.

item.title: Donald Trump signs Epstein files bill into law, triggering 30-day deadline for document release
item.description: US President Donald Trump says he has signed off on legislation to force the release of the "Epstein files" — the final step required to turn the bill into law.

item.title: Meta's teen ban is looming — here's how you can download your content
item.description: Meta warns it will start axing the Meta accounts of under 16s from December 4. Here's how you can download your data before then.

item.title: Man charged over allegedly abandoning Arnie the German shepherd in car after claiming dog and vehicle were stolen
item.description: Queensland Police had been investigating the alleged theft of a vehicle and Arnie the German shepherd, from Brisbane's bayside.

item.title: Young cricketer Ben Austin remembered as a 'champion' at emotional Junction Oval funeral
item.description: Melbourne's Junction Oval was a sea of cricket shirts, football jumpers and scarves as friends and family gathered to farewell beloved teenager Ben Austin, who died in a tragic cricket accident last month.

item.title: Kumanjayi White's family says NT DPP too slow to deliver death in custody findings
item.description: Kumanjayi White investigation continues six months on from his death as the Department of Public Prosecutions awaits "the provision of further material" from NT Police. But the family says the findings are taking too long.

item.title: F1 Las Vegas start time, how to watch grand prix, and drivers' championship standings
item.description: Oscar Piastri enters the third-last grand prix of the season further away from the drivers' championship lead than he has been all year.

item.title: Australia names first Ashes Test team, with Jake Weatherald and Brendan Doggett set to debut in Perth
item.description: Australia is set to blood two debutants in a Test for the first time since 2019 as the Ashes get underway in Perth on Friday.

item.title: Chun Lai Yuen pleads guilty after Burswood car cruise crash that seriously injured Caitlyn Dickson
item.description: A Chinese national admits dangerous driving over a "horrific" crash at a car club meet-up that left 17-year-old Caitlyn Dickson with life-threatening injuries.

item.title: Teenager sentenced to at least 13 years' prison for unprovoked murder of Ethan Hoac
item.description: The killer of Ethan Hoac — who was murdered in an unprovoked attack in Melbourne's north-west in 2023 — is sentenced to more than a decade behind bars for a crime labelled "appalling" and "vicious".

item.title: ACT Chief Police Officer Scott Lee and Police Minister Marisa Paterson speak to media
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Alice Springs residents call for more security at Mallam Crescent housing commission units
item.description: A 92-year-old man and his daughter are calling for the Department of Housing to install better security at a block of Alice Springs housing commission units, after a series of assaults on elderly residents.

item.title: CCTV of Rajwinder Singh, recorded before alleged murder of Toyah Cordingley, played to jury
item.description: Police compiled the CCTV and traffic camera vision by tracking a car registered to Rajwinder Singh before Toyah Cordingley was allegedly murdered.

item.title: Mexican woman jailed in connection with killings of Australian surfers Jake and Callum Robinson
item.description: A woman has been sentenced to 20 years in jail for her role in a robbery in which three men, including two Australian brothers, were killed in Mexico last year.

item.title: The big names and shows coming to the ABC in 2026, from Julia Morris in Class Clowns to Guy Sebastian in The Piano
item.description: Stars including Anne Edmonds, Sam Pang and Shaun Tan are attached to the ABC's 2026 line-up with old audience favourites and new series coming next year.

item.title: Upgrades to WA public transport payment system to be rolled out in early December
item.description: After delays and budget blowouts, Perth commuters will be able to use credit cards, phones and smart watches to swipe onto public transport and pay for their fares from December 8.

item.title: Hotels 'disappointed' by COP31 loss, but SA Premier suggests future bid
item.description: South Australian Premier Peter Malinauskas has not given up hope for Adelaide to potentially host the UN climate summit in the future, after Australia ceded the hosting rights for next year's event to Türkiye.

item.title: Joe Root's century drought in Australia could end this Ashes — but where is it most likely to happen?
item.description: He's one of the best batters in the world right now, but Joe Root is yet to score a century on Australian soil — can he finally end that drought this summer?

item.title: Alleged violence within the CFMEU a 'cancer', administrator tells Queensland inquiry
item.description: The CFMEU administrator has revealed plans to expel ousted Queensland, Victorian and New South Wales leaders, describing alleged violence within the powerful union as a "cancer".

item.title: Docklands to be ready for BBL cricket as Melbourne Renegades consider move
item.description: The boss of Docklands Stadium insists a decision to pivot to entertainment events will not lead to lacklustre BBL pitches, as the Melbourne Renegades weigh up their future at the ground.

item.title: EPA investigating after hundreds of fish found dead in Victoria's Tarwin River
item.description: The Environment Protection Authority investigates the death of hundreds of fish in the Tarwin River in Victoria's South Gippsland.

item.title: NSW Police pepper spray 87-year-old man in Sydney aged care home
item.description: Police officers pepper sprayed an 87-year-old man in a nursing home in south-west Sydney after he was seen brandishing "a metal ornament".

item.title: Why celebrity scandals can leave us feeling shattered
item.description: Whether it's controversy around a jeans ad, voting for a political party you disagree with, or criminal allegations, it can feel confronting to learn more about a person you admire.

item.title: Narco subs appear in Pacific amid warnings cartels are ramping up trafficking to Australia
item.description: The discovery of narco subs bearing the hallmarks of boats used by Mexican and South American drug cartels has intensified warnings that international syndicates are increasingly targeting the lucrative Australian and New Zealand illicit drug markets.

item.title: Mother allegedly locked manslaughter victim in alarmed room, neglect trial hears
item.description: A mother standing trial for the alleged criminal neglect and manslaughter of her daughter made the girl hit herself, locked her in an alarmed room and cut off most of her hair, a court has heard. Warning: This story includes references to child abuse and self-harm, which may be distressing to readers.

item.title: Education minister says errors in legal studies, biology exams are being worked through
item.description: A senior secondary teacher says an error like the one found on the Tasmanian Certificate of Education legal studies exam paper "is really bad", as the education minister moves to assure students the errors would not affect end-of-year results.

item.title: Environmental, noise impacts from Burswood racetrack plan not significant, EPA decides
item.description: The path is cleared for a controversial racetrack to be built in Perth after Western Australia's environmental watchdog decides against launching a formal project assessment.

item.title: Gunmen kill vice principal, abduct female students in attack on Nigerian school
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Schoolgirls the target of mass abductions in Nigeria
item.description: The kidnappers arrived on motorcycles, scaled the school fence and shot the vice-principal as he tried to protect his students.

item.title: Albanese cops summit loss, Liberals go hunting and Hanson gets cooking
item.description: The prime minister didn't seem too bothered as he sold Australia losing out on the rights to host a major climate summit as a win.

item.title: Mark Speakman resigns as NSW Liberals leader with Kellie Sloane tipped to replace him
item.description: NSW Opposition Leader Mark Speakman had declared he would need to be "blasted out" of the role, but his stance shifted this afternoon when it became clear his support had eroded.

item.title: Anti-corruption police raid APY Lands administration office in Umuwa
item.description: South Australia police say several searches have been carried out on multiple premises in the Anangu Pitjantjatjara Yankunytjatjara Lands, including the administration offices in Umuwa.

item.title: England wicketkeeper Jamie Smith could be the tourists' unlikely Ashes secret weapon
item.description: England's wicketkeeper for the Ashes series may look unassuming but as Russell Jackson writes, if Australia underestimates Jamie Smith, they will do so at their peril.

item.title: How politicians could combat doubts about Epstein files release
item.description: As a 30-day timer begins for the US Department of Justice to release its Epstein files, questions remain around whether this will be the definitive release.

item.title: Daly Cherry-Evans unveiling as a Sydney Rooster is a look into a strange new world
item.description: After a rugby league lifetime in maroon and white, Daly Cherry-Evans pulled on his new colours for the first time, and the veteran's move to the Sydney Roosters was a look into an uncanny valley beyond.

item.title: Federal government funding extends cohealth GP services until July 2026
item.description: The Commonwealth will provide $1.5 million in temporary funding to keep the community health clinic's GP services running until July next year.

item.title: Councillors oust Sue Scarman as mayor of Northern Areas Council
item.description: With 12 months still left of her term, a well-known South Australian mayor has been ousted by fellow councillors, but she has challenged them to offer a "legitimate reason" for her dismissal.

item.title: Increased shark activity around Esperance coastline has locals conflicted about solutions
item.description: Vision of sharks off the Esperance coastline ahead of its busy tourist season has some locals concerned and conflicted about solutions.

item.title: Former Olympic snowboarder Ryan Wedding on FBI's most wanted list
item.description: Ryan Wedding once represented Canada at the Winter Olympics. Now he's one of the FBI's most wanted people.
